Sure, here are some accessible outdoor activities in Budapest that you may enjoy:

1. Budapest City Park: Located in the heart of Budapest, City Park offers many accessible outdoor activities, such as boating on the lake, cycling, and picnicking. The City Park has an accessible playground for children with disabilities and an accessible zoo. 2. Margaret Island: A large island in the middle of the Danube river, Margaret Island has several accessible walking paths, a wheelchair-accessible fountain, and a musical fountain show. Visitors can also rent bikes and pedal carts, or take a relaxing thermal bath in the island's spa. 3. Gellért Hill: Gellért Hill provides stunning panoramic views of the city and the Danube river. The hill can be accessed by a combination of the public transportation and elevator or with a private vehicle transfer service. There are several wheelchair-friendly walking paths, benches, and lookout points. 4. Hungarian State Opera House: The Hungarian State Opera House is a historical building with accessible tours and performances. The Opera House has an accessible entrance, wheelchair ramps, and accessible seating. 5. Budapest Castle District: Budapest Castle District is a romantic place that offers amazing views of the city. Wheelchair users can reach the district via a small funicular, and there are several accessible points of interest, such as the Matthias Church and the Fisherman's Bastion. I hope these suggestions are helpful and that you have a great time exploring Budapest's beautiful outdoors!
